Articles.Content:
So, this is a thing:

It appears there's a whole bunch of double-clickable areas all over stock cockpits/cabins, and Kraken only knows how many in mod cockpits, that act as extra points which you can look from, including a whole downstairs corridor loop in MK2 inline, and a bunch of seasoned players (including me) are only learning about this now. And it's a little tedious to keep double-clicking everything in sight in hopes of hitting the one spot that changes your point of view.

Wouldn't it be nice if there was *some* hint as to where the extra cameras or otherwise active/clickable elements are? Say, a highlight, a'la 'active part', or a glowy particle, or a tooltip or cursor color change when you hover the element, or whatever way you think easiest to implement to hint "this is clickable" that would work globally, applying to all cockpits and cabin (stock and mod) without need to edit them?

Edited January 18, 2017 by Sharpy
Or the devs could just allow us to actually walk around via WASD keys
